headline.main: Insight-Does a Happy Employee Make for a Healthy Stock Price?
headline.print_headline: Insight-Does a Happy Employee Make for a Healthy Stock Price?

docs.snippet: When BlackRock, the world’s largest asset manager, evaluates potential stock purchases, its managers look at all the usual financial metrics....
docs.lead_paragraph: When BlackRock, the world’s largest asset manager, evaluates potential stock purchases, its managers look at all the usual financial metrics.

headline.main: Feds: No Civil Rights Charges in NY Football Player Shooting
headline.print_headline: Feds: No Civil Rights Charges in NY Football Player Shooting

docs.snippet: No federal civil rights charges will be brought in the 2010 shooting death of a college football player by a suburban New York police officer who says he shot him in his moving car when he failed to stop, a prosecutor said Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: No federal civil rights charges will be brought in the 2010 shooting death of a college football player by a suburban New York police officer who says he shot him in his moving car when he failed to stop, a prosecutor said Tuesday.

headline.main: S. Carolina police officer faces murder charge over shooting of black man
headline.sub: S. Carolina police officer faces murder charge over shooting of black man

docs.snippet: A white South Carolina police officer will be charged with murder over the shooting death of a black man who appeared to be fleeing from him. Rough Cut (no reporter narration)....
docs.lead_paragraph: A white South Carolina police officer will be charged with murder over the shooting death of a black man who appeared to be fleeing from him. Rough Cut (no reporter narration).

headline.main: Arab States Want U.N. to Blacklist Former Yemen President's Son
headline.print_headline: Arab States Want U.N. to Blacklist Former Yemen President's Son

docs.snippet: Gulf Arab countries and Jordan want the United Nations Security Council to blacklist the son of Yemen's former president and a Houthi militia leader and effectively impose an arms embargo on the rebels that rule most of the poor Arabian peninsula ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Gulf Arab countries and Jordan want the United Nations Security Council to blacklist the son of Yemen's former president and a Houthi militia leader and effectively impose an arms embargo on the rebels that rule most of the poor Arabian peninsula country.

headline.main: Burkina Law Bars Ex-President's Allies From Running for Office
headline.print_headline: Burkina Law Bars Ex-President's Allies From Running for Office

docs.snippet: Lawmakers in Burkina Faso modified the electoral code on Tuesday to prevent people from standing for office if they had supported a failed move last year to allow then-President Blaise Compaore to seek a new term....
docs.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers in Burkina Faso modified the electoral code on Tuesday to prevent people from standing for office if they had supported a failed move last year to allow then-President Blaise Compaore to seek a new term.

headline.main: Selena's Estate Sues Record Label Over Digital Royalties
headline.print_headline: Selena's Estate Sues Record Label Over Digital Royalties

docs.snippet: The estate of the late Texas pop star Selena is suing a record label it says owes it money from digital royalties....
docs.lead_paragraph: The estate of the late Texas pop star Selena is suing a record label it says owes it money from digital royalties.

headline.main: Documentary on Disease That Claimed Nimoy's Life in Works
headline.print_headline: Documentary on Disease That Claimed Nimoy's Life in Works

docs.snippet: Leonard Nimoy's daughter is planning a documentary about the disease that claimed the actor's life....

headline.main: Critics of Iran Nuclear Deal 'Disingenuous,' CIA's Brennan Says
headline.print_headline: Critics of Iran Nuclear Deal 'Disingenuous,' CIA's Brennan Says

docs.snippet: Opponents of Iran's initial agreement to curb its nuclear program are being "disingenuous" when they say the deal could still allow the Middle Eastern state to build nuclear weapons, the head of the Central Intelligence Agency said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Opponents of Iran's initial agreement to curb its nuclear program are being "disingenuous" when they say the deal could still allow the Middle Eastern state to build nuclear weapons, the head of the Central Intelligence Agency said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Activists rally with cardboard coffins to protest police brutality
headline.sub: Activists rally with cardboard coffins to protest police brutality

docs.snippet: Hundreds of protesters carry cardboard coffins along the streets of Los Angeles to protest against law enforcement. Rough cut - no reporter narration....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of protesters carry cardboard coffins along the streets of Los Angeles to protest against law enforcement. Rough cut - no reporter narration.
